org.ggp.base.util.reasoner.gdl

Class GdlChainingReasoner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.util.reasoner.gdl.GdlChainingReasoner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DifferentialForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>, ForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>

    public class GdlChainingReasoner
extends java.lang.Object
implements DifferentialForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>
    An implementation of a ForwardChainingReasoner that uses Gdl objects directly and allows for differential processing of rules.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Given a rule and all sentences known to be true so far, returns all new results of applying the rule.
      GdlSentenceSet getRuleResultsForNewSentences(GdlRule rule, SentenceDomainModel domainModel, GdlSentenceSet allSentences, GdlSentenceSet newSentences)
      Given a rule, all sentences known to be true, and a set of new sentences, returns all new results of the rule that involve at least one of the new sentences as a positive literal in the body of the rule.

      Returns the union of the two sets of sentences.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static GdlChainingReasoner create(SentenceFormModel model)

      • getConstantSentences

        public GdlSentenceSet getConstantSentences()
        Description copied from interface: ForwardChainingReasoner
        Returns a set of sentences that are always true, which can be used as a basis and added to via getUnion. This includes all constant values defined explicitly in the game description. It may include other sentences that are always true based on game rules, depending on the implementation and how it is instantiated.
        Specified by:
        getConstantSentences in interface ForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>

      • getRuleResults

        public GdlSentenceSet getRuleResults(GdlRule rule,
                                     SentenceDomainModel domainModel,
                                     GdlSentenceSet sentencesSoFar)
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ForwardChainingReasoner
        Given a rule and all sentences known to be true so far, returns all new results of applying the rule. For the outputs of this method to be valid, the GDL that the rule is derived from should have had the VariableConstrainer transformation applied to it.
        Specified by:
        getRuleResults in interface ForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getUnion

        public GdlSentenceSet getUnion(GdlSentenceSet oldSentences,
                               GdlSentenceSet newSentences)
        Description copied from interface: ForwardChainingReasoner
        Returns the union of the two sets of sentences. Calling this method invalidates oldSentences.
        Specified by:
        getUnion in interface ForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>

      • isSubsetOf

        public boolean isSubsetOf(GdlSentenceSet oldSentences,
                          GdlSentenceSet newSentences)
        Description copied from interface: ForwardChainingReasoner
        Returns true iff newSentences is a subset of oldSentences.
        Specified by:
        isSubsetOf in interface ForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>

      • getRuleResultsForNewSentences

        public GdlSentenceSet getRuleResultsForNewSentences(GdlRule rule,
                                                    SentenceDomainModel domainModel,
                                                    GdlSentenceSet allSentences,
                                                    GdlSentenceSet newSentences)
                                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: DifferentialForwardChainingReasoner
        Given a rule, all sentences known to be true, and a set of new sentences, returns all new results of the rule that involve at least one of the new sentences as a positive literal in the body of the rule. Sentences already known to be true will not be included in the result. This can be a more efficient way of dealing with recursive rules than ForwardChainingReasoner.getRuleResults(Object, SentenceDomainModel, Object). For the outputs of this method to be valid, the GDL that the rule is derived from should have had the VariableConstrainer transformation applied to it.
        Specified by:
        getRuleResultsForNewSentences in interface DifferentialForwardChainingReasoner<GdlRule,GdlSentenceSet>
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
